SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
REBATE MANAGEMENT
Manage Rebates and Incentives Within Sales Processes

Craft better deals and make the right incentive decisions within your existing sales and Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) processes. Account managers, sales teams, dealers, distributors, and rebate managers can better visualize an account’s rebate attainment, view projected rebate amounts on transactions, make informed decisions, and better negotiate deals. They can view rebates an account is earning from in the context of a sales transaction, or select eligible rebate types and add them to the transaction. All applicable incentives are visible in the context of the transaction be it a Quote, Opportunity, Order, Sales Agreement, Contract, or any other transaction.

Eligible and Applied Rebate Types on a Transactional Object
An account manager can view the rebate types in an org that are eligible for a contract, quote, or any other sales object record. The account manager can also view the rebate programs in which the account for a contract, quote, or any other sales object is already enrolled. The Program Rebate Types panel on a record page can be configured to show both eligible and applied rebate types for the record.
List of Supported Objects for Eligible and Applied Rebate Types
Seamlessly add rebate information to standard sales and Configure, Price, and Quote (CPQ) processes. The Program Rebate Types panel on a record page layout shows the list of eligible and applied rebate types for a record. The panel also shows projected rebates or incentives, current progress against a rebate type, the amount required to reach the next benefit tier, and the total projected rebate amount for the current year.
Map Fields Between Target Transaction Object and Transaction Journal
To view eligible and applied rebate types on any object’s record, map the fields of the object with fields in Transaction Journal by using the ObjectHierarchyRelationship metadata API. If you don’t create these field mappings, Rebate Management shows all integratable rebate types on the Eligible tab and doesn’t show any rebate type on the Applied tab of the Program Rebate Types panel.
Design a Screen Flow to Add Selected Rebate Types to a Sales Object
Design a screen flow to craft a business process when eligible rebate types are selected and added to a target record. Account managers can select multiple rebate types from the Eligible tab of the Program Rebate Types panel. They confirm the selections by either adding the rebate types and the associated account to a new program or the existing rebate program. The admin can create a screen flow and even use APIs to extend the logic of how this process is automated.
Add the Lightning Components for Rebates to Page Layouts
Use the Program Rebate Types Panel Lightning component to select and apply eligible rebate types to target records such as orders, contracts, quotes, or any eligible standard or custom objects. Use the Program Rebate Types Tab Lightning component to view and modify the applied rebate types within a target record’s page.
View and Apply Eligible Rebate Types on a Transactional Object
View a list of eligible rebate types for a target record on the Eligible tab of the Program Rebate Types Panel card. Apply the selected eligible rebate types to the record with a screen flow. If the account of the target record is enrolled in rebate programs, the associated rebate types are displayed on the Applied tab of the Program Rebate Types Panel card.
Modify Rebate Types in Context of a Record
Use the Program Rebate Types related list on a record to view the applied rebate types, and modify the benefits, eligibility criteria, and other details during the negotiation process. Remove any rebate types that aren’t required.

title: Managing Incentives within Sales Processes
